result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:01 AM Defendant Paul McFarling Gray in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Kelly J. Freeman by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Oscar Asilis of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Parties stipulate to conviction in Milwaukee County case 18CF2283. State moves for bind over, defense opposes. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
